alert.note: Alert for Dawes; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 4:14AM CST until February 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow ending, with a continued period of extremely dangerous wind chills. Additional accumulations generally less than one inch. Wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...East central Wyoming into the northern Nebraska Panhandle including Douglas, Lusk, Harrison, and Chadron. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory ends at 11 AM MST this morning. Wind Chill Warning in effect until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roadways and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously low wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in 5 minutes or less. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of light snow is possible late Tuesday night through Wednesday. Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches will be possible.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
